wikipedia_page.main:
Air Commodore Douglas Douglas-Hamilton, 14th Duke of Hamilton and 11th Duke of Brandon,  (3 February 1903 – 30 March 1973) was a Scottish nobleman and aviator who was one of the first men to fly over Mount Everest.
When Germany's Deputy-Führer Rudolf Hess made his surprise landing in Scotland in May 1941, he claimed he knew Hamilton, who denied this, although the two were believed to have met at the Berlin Olympics and possibly remained in contact since. Hamilton was, however, declared in Parliament to be innocent of any breach of security.
